name: ITIL 4 Service Value System (SVS)
description: The ITIL service value system describes how all the components and activities of an organization work together to facilitate value creation.

guiding_principles.name: Focus on value
guiding_principles.description: Everything the organization does should link back, directly or indirectly, to value for stakeholders.

guiding_principles.name: Start where you are
guiding_principles.description: Do not start over without first observing the current state and deciding what can be preserved.

guiding_principles.name: Progress iteratively with feedback
guiding_principles.description: Resist the temptation to do everything at once. Organize work into smaller, manageable sections.

guiding_principles.name: Collaborate and promote visibility
guiding_principles.description: Working together across boundaries produces results that have greater buy-in, more relevance, and increased likelihood of long-term success.

guiding_principles.name: Think and work holistically
guiding_principles.description: The service management system must be designed to work in an integrated way, rather than as a collection of isolated parts.

guiding_principles.name: Keep it simple and practical
guiding_principles.description: Always use the minimum number of steps to accomplish an objective.

guiding_principles.name: Optimize and automate
guiding_principles.description: Optimize first, then automate. Human intervention should only happen where it really adds value.

service_value_chain.description: The service value chain is an operating model that outlines the key activities required to respond to demand and facilitate value realization.

activities.name: Plan
activities.purpose: Ensure a shared understanding of the vision, current status, and improvement direction
key_inputs: Policies and requirements from governing body

activities.name: Improve
activities.purpose: Ensure continual improvement of products, services, and practices
key_inputs: Knowledge and information about third-party service components

activities.name: Engage
activities.purpose: Provide a good understanding of stakeholder needs, transparency, and continual engagement

activities.name: Design and transition
activities.purpose: Ensure that products and services continually meet stakeholder expectations

activities.name: Obtain/build
activities.purpose: Ensure that service components are available when and where needed

activities.name: Deliver and support
activities.purpose: Ensure that services are delivered and supported according to agreed specifications
key_outputs: Incident resolution and service request fulfillment

governance.description: The means by which an organization is directed and controlled

value_streams.description: Value streams define how an organization delivers value to its customers and stakeholders
